The existing Heritrix defaults are a reasonable place to start, though 
some sites can be inconvenienced even at a slower rate, and large 
well-provisioned sites can often accept faster traffic.

So it all depends on your target sites, and it is always important to 
include an URL with contact information in your crawler's User-Agent 
string, and respond promptly to webmasters expressing concern about the 
crawler's effects.

My IA colleage Steve has pointed out a nice discussion of issues in 
choosing crawler politeness delays at Wikipedia:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_crawler#Politeness_policy

The Heritrix policy is inspired by the Mercator policy, with the 
'delay-factor' setting controlling what multiple of the previous 
fetch-duration used as a preferred delay. That target value is clipped 
to within the 'min-delay-ms' and 'max-delay-ms' range. Finally, a 
'Crawl-Delay', if specified by the site's robots.txt, is applied as an 
additional floor, up to some maximum value. It's all configurable, but 
any changes should be made with sensitivity to target sites.

- Gordon @ IA
